unit1.title: Introduction to Variables and Basic Operations
unit1.description:
Complete the following tasks:

Part A: Create a variable that stores the sum of 15 and 27.

Part B: Create a variable that stores the result of 100 divided by 4.

Part C: Create a variable that stores my favorite number (hint: its 42) multiplied by 2.

Your submit_answers() function should return a list with three values: [part_a, part_b, part_c]

unit2.title: Data types and operators
unit2.description:
Complete the following tasks:

Part A: Write an expression that takes a number (x) and returns True if x is even, and False if it is odd.

Part B: Write an expression that returns True if a number (x) is greater than 11 and also odd.

Part C: Write an expression that multiplies two numbers (x and y) and then floor divides the result by a third number (z).

Your submit_answers() function should return [part_a_result, part_b_result, part_c_result].

unit3.title: Conditionals
unit3.description:
Complete the following tasks:

Part A: Write a conditional that checks if a number x is negative, positive, or zero, and returns the corresponding string.

Part B: Create an expression that returns True if x is divisible by both 3 and 7, otherwise False.

Part C: Write a conditional that assigns 'Weekend' if day is 'Saturday' or 'Sunday', otherwise 'Weekday'.

Your submit_answers() function should return [part_a_result, part_b_result, part_c_result].

unit4.title: Loops
unit4.description:
Complete the following tasks:

Part A: Use a for loop to compute the sum of all even numbers between 1 and 100 (inclusive).

Part B: Use a while loop to count how many times you can subtract 5 from 100 before the number becomes negative.

Part C: Use a nested loop to count how many pairs (i, j) exist where both i and j range from 1 to 10 and i * j is even.

Your submit_answers() function should return [part_a_result, part_b_result, part_c_result].

unit5.title: Lists
unit5.description:
Complete the following tasks:

Part A: Create a list of the numbers 1â€“10 and return the sum of all elements at even indices.

Part B: Return the length of a list after removing all elements greater than 5 from [2, 8, 3, 9, 1, 7, 4].

Part C: Reverse the list [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] without using .reverse() or slicing.

Your submit_answers() function should return [part_a_result, part_b_result, part_c_result].

unit6.title: Functions
unit6.description:
Complete the following tasks:

Part A: Define a function square(n) that returns n ** 2, then call it with 7.

Part B: Define a function compare(a, b) that returns 'Equal', 'Greater', or 'Smaller' depending on the relation between a and b.

Part C: Write a higher-order function that takes another function f and a number x, and returns f(x) + 1; test it using your square function and x = 3.

Your submit_answers() function should return [part_a_result, part_b_result, part_c_result].

unit7.title: Outside Packages
unit7.description:
Complete the following tasks:

Part A: Use the math module to calculate the factorial of 6.

Part B: Enter the function call to get a random integer from 50-100. (do this in the format random.function(input1, input2)

Part C: Use the turtle module to draw a square of side length 50, then return the number of sides drawn.

Your submit_answers() function should return [part_a_result, part_b_result, part_c_result].
